Transmutation.definition: a doctrine in property law which allows the conversion of a separate property interest into marital or community property by agreement between spouses or by contribution of marital or community assets to the separate property

1.definition: a doctrine in property law which allows the conversion of a separate property interest into marital or community property by agreement between spouses or by contribution of marital or community assets to the separate property (as for maintenance or improvements)a doctrine in property law which allows the conversion of a marital or community property interest into separate property

2.definition: an act or instance of converting a property interest in accordance with the doctrine of transmutation [absent a by deed]
